stem: Complete the assessment findings for an infant with intussusception.
template: A classic clinical sign of intussusception is the passage of {{stool}} stools and the palpation of a {{mass}} in the right upper quadrant.

rationale.correct: Intussusception occurs when one part of the intestine telescopes into another. (1) Ischemia leads to stool mixed with blood and mucus (Currant jelly). (2) The dense segment of bowel is palpable as a sausage-shaped mass.
rationale.incorrect: Olive-shaped mass is pyloric stenosis. Steatorrhea is characteristic of cystic fibrosis or celiac disease.

answerBreakdown.label: Blank 1
answerBreakdown.content: The selection of "currant jelly (blood/mucus mixed)" correctly completes the clinical hypothesis based on assessment cues.

answerBreakdown.label: Blank 2
answerBreakdown.content: The selection of "sausage-shaped mass" correctly completes the clinical hypothesis based on assessment cues.

clinicalPearls: The first-line treatment for stable intussusception is often an air (pneumatic) or saline enema, which 'pushes' the bowel back into place.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: If the infant passes a normal brown stool, notify the provider immediately! This often means the intussusception has resolved on its own, and surgery/enema may no longer be needed.

reviewUnits.body: Nurses monitor for drawing up of the knees and sudden, inconsolable crying in infants.
